titleStmt.title: Dispatch from Henry F. Downing to George L. Rives, February 14, 1888

bibl.title: Dispatch from Henry F. Downing to George L. Rives
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

div1.p:
United States Consulate
St. Paul de Loanda,
February 14th, 1888

Mr. Downing,
To the Department of State.
Same as above, cost of erection and purchase of flag staff of moving and preservation of archives

United States Consulate,
St. Paul de Loanda
February 14th, 1888.

Hon. G. L. Rives,
Assistant Secretary of State,
Washington, D.C.

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of despatch number 32, dated Dec. 20. 1887. And, in accordance with instructions contained therein, I have to inform you that the purchase and erection of a flag staff at this Consulate will cost from $110.00/100 to $130.00/100.
To some the experience of removing archives I have expanded $8.00/100. What "their proper preservation" will cost it is impossible for me to state.

I have the honor to be,
Sir,
Your obedient servant,
Henry F. Downing,
U.S. Consul
